name: PixelFem #34 - Whina Cooper
description:
Whina Cooper was a Maori teacher, storekeeper, community leader, and activist who fought lifelong for Maori rights in New Zealand/Aotearoa. Aged 80, Cooper led the 1975 Maori land march from the Far North to Parliament (1,000 kilometres), inspiring countless New Zealanders. The march put Maori Treaty grievances on the national agenda and made Cooper a symbol of Maori cultural revival. She was affectionately dubbed 'Mother of the Nation'.

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
